channel.title: Homes on Chao Zhang
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Chao Zhang

item.description: My research areas are data mining and machine learning. My recent work centers around acquiring knowledge from unstructured text data, with emphasis on improving label efficiency and robustness of learning algorithms. Methodologically, I am particularly interested in weakly-supervised learning (CIKM’18, AAAI’19), unsupervised learning (ICML’19), probabilistic models (KDD’19), and uncertainty estimation (UbiComp’18). Prior to joining Georgia Tech, I obtained my Ph.D. in Computer Science from UIUC, where I worked with Jiawei Han on text mining (KDD’17, KDD’18, ICDM’18) and spatiotemporal data mining (VLDB’14, KDD’15, KDD’16, KDD’17, SIGIR’16, WWW’17).
